thread.title: Grapevine: Hayden Panettiere seeks treatment for postpartum depression
thread.title_full: Grapevine: Hayden Panettiere seeks treatment for postpartum depression

author: detroitnews.com
title: Grapevine: Hayden Panettiere seeks treatment for postpartum depression
text:
Hayden Panettiere gave birth to her daughter in December. (Photo: Jason Merritt / Getty Images) 
Hayden Panettiere voluntarily checks into treatment center 
This week actress Hayden Panettiere entered a facility to seek treatment for postpartum depression. “Hayden Panettiere is voluntarily seeking professional help,” her rep told E! News. “She asks that the media respect her privacy during this time.” The “Nashville” star mentioned her struggle last month on “Live! With Kelly and Michael,” saying “you don’t realize how broad of a spectrum you can really experience that on. It’s something that needs to be talked about. Women need to know that they’re not alone, and that it does heal.” Panettiere gave birth to her daughter Kaya in December. The father is her fiance Wladimir Klitschko , the 39-year-old reigning world heavyweight boxing champion.
Teammates, celebrities show support for Lamar Odom 
After NBA star Lamar Odom was found unconscious at a Nevada brothel earlier this week, stars have taken to social media to show their support. Former teammate LaBron James posted a photo of the two on Instagram saying “I truly hope this isn’t the last stop for you because you still have so much to give, not even to others but to yourself more importantly. Never know what someone is going through unless you're walking in their shoes. No judgment. Straight up homie!” Dwayne Wade tweeted “Thinking about my ex teammate/friend LO. On my knees praying...please God let him pull thru.” Former Detroit Piston Isiah Thomas and model Beverly Johnson also took to Twitter to say they were praying for Odom. Lil Wayne tweeted “R.I.P. LO” but quickly corrected himself. As of press time, Odom was still unresponsive in the hospital, according to reports. He married Khloe Kardashian in 2009 and they divorced in July.
‘Dance Moms’ star indicted 
Known for her tough love teaching ways and her big mouth, “Dance Moms” star Abby Lee Miller has been charged with bankruptcy fraud. Feds are alleging that the reality star, 50, hid $775,000 worth of income from her Lifetime show while filing Chapter 11 bankruptcy. She hid income from television appearances, dance sessions and merchandise sales from 2012 and 2013. The Associated Press reports that the bankruptcy judge became suspicious after he saw Miller on television while channel surfing.
Also... 
■ Popular scientist Dr. Neil deGrasse Tyson returns to Detroit for a speaking engagement at Fox Theatre on March 24. Tickets to see the best selling author and host of “StarTalk” on the National Geographic channel go on sale Nov. 6 at 10 a.m. They’re $48.50-$250 and can be purchased via the venue or Ticketmaster.
■ “Thor” actor Chris Hemsworth joined Instagram this week. His first photo depicted him in his backyard with a giant snake crawling through the grass. His caption: “Hangin’ with the locals in my backyard...the real Jurassic Park!” Although he only had one photo posted at press time, the Australian actor had already amassed more than 300,000 followers.
Compiled by Melody Baetens 
mbaetens@detroitnews.com
